name: AddReactionToCommitComment
description:
Add a reaction to a GitHub commit comment.

Use this tool to add a reaction (like, love, etc.) to a comment on a GitHub commit. It confirms if the reaction was already added with an HTTP `200` status.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The GitHub username of the repository owner. This value is case-insensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the GitHub commit comment to which the reaction will be added.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the comment.

parameters.name: reaction_type
parameters.description: The type of reaction to add to the commit comment, e.g., '+1', 'heart', 'laugh'.

value_schema.description: The [reaction type](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/reference/reactions#reaction-types) to add to the commit comment.
